text.p: NetManage Inc Tuesday said it will acquire NetSoft Inc, a privately held developer of computer communications software, for $26 million in cash.
In a statement, NetManage said the deal will create one of the largest vendors in the PC connectivity market. NetManage makes products that help networks connect and communicate.

"With the acquisition of NetSoft, we will expand our leadership position in the UNIX Connectivity and Host Connectivity markets to create one of the broadest product and service offerings for new and existing customers," said Zvi Alon, NetManage chief executive.

NetSoft Chief Executive Officer Patrick Linehan will become senior vice president and general manager of the core business unit at NetManage. That unit will encompass the NetManage Chameleon and NetSoft product lines.
Alon will retain the position of president and CEO of NetManage, focusing on the emerging business unit.
The transaction will be accounted for by the purchase method and is expected to close in August.
NetManage shares were up 7/16 at 3-3/4 by mid-afternoon.
NetSoft is based in Irvine, California.
